oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: The New Digital Bleek and Lloyd Archive
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |han=kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The locusts (with the locust birds which accompany them) are set free by Sorcerers. Stones not to be thrown at the locusts. (L V.-21. 5708-5719 1/2) (L VIII.-31. 8754-8758). |han=kass'o and ||hoaken !khe were told by |han=kass'o's grandfather not to throw stones at locusts. A second part of the story concerns |kaunu who says 'locusts come out' when he wants to drive the locusts with the children. 1) p.8756v: the locust bird and the locusts, 2) See also Locust birds and The locust bird or ||kerri, 3) This story is found in Book VIII-31.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Throwing stones at locusts
